job.title: Director of Engineering, Autolist
job.description:
About Autolist
For most people, shopping for a vehicle is an experience we'd rather forget. Navigating a sea of endless options, spending hours, and the dealership and negotiating toe-to-toe with a dealer who does all this every day leaves automotive shoppers feeling exhausted and overwhelmed while hopeful, but not sure, they got a vehicle in good condition for a fair price.
Autolist is on a mission to rewire the automotive industry by making it easier for everyone to find and get a vehicle they love! We are creating an automotive shopping experience for every stage of the automotive life cycle - buying, selling, owning - and we're well on our way. As an independent brand and subsidiary of CarGurus (NASDAQ: CARG) we're a startup within the worldwide category leader in automotive shopping helping millions of monthly users via our award-winning apps and web shopping platforms. Our efforts to streamline the automotive shopping experience is supported by a strong passion to empower people with the knowledge and experience they need for everything automotive, a dedication to equity, inclusion, and belonging, and world-class benefits.
What You'll Do
As the
Director of Engineering Manager
at Autolist you will provide managerial and technical leadership in a lean, fast-paced, data-driven environment. You will be deeply engaged in the leadership of the company, our culture, product strategy, technical strategy, and more. You will work alongside our engineers and managers to deliver great products and support the full development lifecycle discovering, designing, developing, testing, deploying, maintaining, observing, and improving our software.
You will own the success of our engineers in developing their careers as well as executing on products. You will be hands-on and collaborative with fellow engineers, analysts, designers, product, and business partners as you solve exciting problems with real impact at scale.
This role will report to the General Manager of Autolist and be a member of the Autolist Leadership Team.
Responsibilities
Manage a growing organization with 3+ engineering managers and 15+ engineers
Lead recruiting efforts to thoughtfully grow the team
Mentor and motivate the engineering team, contributing to the career development of others
Lead the technical strategy and setting of standards, technical vision, and culture
Support the teams to prioritize and scope engineering investments
Assist in the delivery and maintenance of products: write code, perform code reviews, and define best practices
Eliminate roadblocks, and make sure each team member has everything to achieve their full potential
Actively drive the development of the Autolist culture
Partner with product, business, and design teams to implement disruptive consumer features
Take an active role in the day to day operations of the engineering team
Own goals, deadlines, and be a partner in company-wide strategic planning
Keep the team focused on the highest-impact tasks and projects
Provide an open and friendly line of communication for engineers to voice their success and concerns
Make sure the engineers' experience at Autolist is a positive one
Serve as a link between engineering, the executive team, and HR, to help the engineers be successful
Inspire engineers to follow and refine best practices
What Success Looks Like
Success of Engineering direct reports
Timely and impactful delivery of products and projects
Achievement of company goals and objectives
The growth and career development of Autolist engineers
Communicating with General Manager, engineering managers, and other related executives, and HR, early and often about engineers' successes and concerns
Developer Happiness
Ensuring our technology is built in a way that supports achieving our product and business goals in a timely manner, without putting an impractical burden on future development efforts.
Who You Are
Results-oriented, proven technical leader
10+ years of software development experience
4+ years of management experience
2+ years managing engineering managers
Expertise with both dynamic/interpreted (Javascript, Ruby, Python) and compiled (java, kotlin) languages
Experience with a modern Javascript framework like Next.js, React, Redux
Polyglot engineer comfortable with full stack web development
Strong understanding of Postgres or similar relational databases
Strong understanding of Elasticsearch
Experience maintaining Cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or equivalent) and familiarity with DevOps tools (Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Ansible)
Expertise in maintaining Kubernetes clusters
Understanding of how to build high-performance web applications
Able to conceptualize, develop, test, and release product
Drawn to and thrive in a fast-paced environment that pushes high-quality code continuously
Able to work independently, as well as collaboratively
Note: The requirements listed on this job description are guidelines not hard and fast rules. To excel in this role you will not need to satisfy or meet every requirement listed. If you have the transferable skills and want the opportunity to be considered – please apply!
Bonus
Have worked in a pair-programming environment
An interest in exploring code design and architecture
Have used test-driven development (TDD) extensively
Experience building consumer-facing applications
Experience of working with the auto industry
Practical experience of a range of agile development methodologies
Experience building metasearch products
Security chops (JWT, HMAC, CSP, cryptography)
Performance chops (CWV, CRP, PWA, LnP)
Android and/or iOS experience
M.S. or PhD in Computer Science or related field
Equal Opportunity Statement
Autolist is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that everyone should receive equal consideration and treatment. Recruitment, hiring, placements, transfers, and promotions will happen based on qualifications for the positions being filled regardless of sex, gender identity, race, religious creed, color, national origin ancestry, age, physical disability, pregnancy, mental disability, or medical condition.
Check out this link to learn more about our engineering team: https://www.autolist.com/engineering
